paragraph.paragraph:
A reference item's properties are accessible from the Visual Studio .NET
ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfPropertyBrowser.htm properties window . To view the properties window:
Select the reference item in your EiffelEnvision url*Project.
Choose View, Properties menu.
The properties window may also been shown for any selected item by pressing the F4 keyboard shortcut or by choosing Properties from the reference item's context menu.

Assembly Name
The name of the assembly as embedded in the assembly manifest.

Class Name Prefix
An optional class name prefix to disambiguate the class consumed when a project is ../../compiling_project/index.xmlBuilt. For more information on class name prefixes and their relevance, see *Assembly Type and Method Formatting.
Warning: Changing a prefix after the reference has been compiled into a project will require a clean ../../compiling_project/index.xmlRebuilt to be performed.
Some class name prefixes cannot be modified for a number of assembly references. This is because the prefixed specified, if any, are reserved by Eiffel Software and are used throughout the provided class libraries.

Cluster Name
The cluster name given to the assembly when it is compiled by the Eiffel for .NET compiler. This property is for identity only and cannot be modified.

Copy Local
When set to Yes, the assembly will be copied to the compilation folder when ../../compiling_project/index.xmlbuilding a project to prevent locks being place on the existing assembly.

Culture
The culture of the assembly as embedded in the assembly manifest.

Description
If available, a description of the assembly or COM type library.

Path
The full path to the assembly reference.

Public Key Token
The public key token of the assembly as embedded in the assembly manifest.

Version
The version of the assembly as embedded in the assembly manifest.
